result.name: nhs-commissioning-regions-april-2016-generalised-clipped-boundaries-in-england2
result.notes:
This file contains the digital vector boundaries for NHS commissioning regions (NHSCR) in England as at April 2016. The boundaries available are:

  • Full resolution - extent of the realm (usually this is the Mean Low Water mark but in some cases boundaries extend beyond this to include off shore islands)
  • Full resolution - clipped to the coastline (Mean High Water mark)
  • Generalised (20m) - clipped to the coastline (Mean High Water mark)
  • Super generalised (200m) - clipped to the coastline (Mean High Water mark)
  • Ultra generalised (500m) - clipped to the coastline (Mean High Water mark).

Contains both Ordnance Survey and ONS Intellectual Property Rights.

Download File Sizes
  • Full resolution - extent of the realm (8 MB)
  • Full resolution - clipped to the coastline (12 MB)
  • Generalised (20m) - clipped to the coastline (1 MB)
  • Super generalised (200m) - clipped to the coastline (185 KB)
  • Ultra generalised (500m) - clipped to the coastline (55 KB).

REST URL of ArcGIS for INSPIRE View Service – https://ons-inspire.esriuk.com/arcgis/rest/services/Health_Boundaries/NHS_Commissioning_Regions_April_2016_Boundaries/MapServer/exts/InspireView  

REST URL of ArcGIS for INSPIRE Feature Download Service – https://ons-inspire.esriuk.com/arcgis/rest/services/Health_Boundaries/NHS_Commissioning_Regions_April_2016_Boundaries/MapServer/exts/InspireFeatureDownload

REST URL of ArcGIS Feature Service – https://ons-inspire.esriuk.com/arcgis/rest/services/Health_Boundaries/NHS_Commissioning_Regions_April_2016_Boundaries/FeatureServer

organization.name: office-for-national-statistics
organization.title: Office for National Statistics
organization.description:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics and is the recognised national statistical institute for the UK. It is responsible for collecting and publishing statistics related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. It also conducts the census in England and Wales every ten years. 

The ONS plays a leading role in national and international good practice in the production of official statistics. It is the executive office of the UK Statistics Authority and although they are separate, they are still closely related.

result.title: NHS Commissioning Regions (April 2016) Generalised Clipped Boundaries in England
